intro: Ceropegia caespitosa, commonly known as the woolly milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among species in the Asclepiadaceae family. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a velvety texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ceropegia caespitosa thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate sunlight, making it a popular choice for succulent gardens.
